articles.title: First secretary of c.c., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League elected
articles.content:
First secretary of c.c., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League elected 
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The 23rd plenary meeting of the central committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League was held in Pyongyang yesterday.
 The meeting discussed recall and by-election of the central leadership member of the youth league.   
  Ri Il Hwan was dismissed and removed from the first secretary of the central committee of the youth league for the sake of work and Kim Kyong Ho was elected first 
secretary.

articles.title: Freight wagons for transporting basic foods produced
Reception at German embassy
articles.content:
Reception at German embassy 
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at the German embassy yesterday evening on the occasion of the German National Day. Invited to the reception were minister of foreign trade Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of foreign affairs Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of culture Song Sok Hwan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Jon Yong Jin who is chairman of the Korea-Germany Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations.
 Present were Claus Peter Woerner, German charge d'affaires ad interim, and embassy staff.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Friendly ties established between Kangwon and Morona Santiago provinces
articles.content:
Friendly ties established between Kangwon and Morona Santiago provinces 
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing friendly relations between Kangwon Province of the DPRK and Morona Santiago Province of Ecuador was signed in Wonsan yesterday.
 The agreement was inked by Ko Jong Dok, chairman of the Kangwon Provincial People's Committee, and Jaime Mejia Reinoso, governor of the Morona Santiago provincial government.

articles.title: Title of Hero of Republic awarded to 15-ton air hammer
articles.content:
Title of Hero of Republic awarded to 15-ton air hammer 
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The title of Hero of the Republic and gold-star medal and the order of the National Flag First Class were awarded to the 15-ton air hammer in the wheel shop of the July 6 Railway Factory yesterday.
 The hammer has been in full operation for the last 30 years, thus making great contributions to producing many parts necessary for railway transportation and the industrialization of the country.

articles.title: Arms buildup in S. Korea denounced
Leading officials meet newly appointed Russian ambassador
articles.content:
Leading officials meet newly appointed Russian ambassador 
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, met and conversed with newly appointed Russian ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov, who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were generals and officers of the Korean People's Army and the military attache of the Russian embassy here.    
 Foreign minister Paek Nam Sun also met and conversed with Andrei Karlov who paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Inter-Korean talks open
Wreaths presented to Mongolian embassy
articles.content:
Wreaths presented to Mongolian embassy
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The Supreme People's Assembly and the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK and the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association today sent wreaths to the Mongolian embassy here, expressing deep condolences over the death of L. Enebish, chairman of the State Great Hural and general secretary of the c.c., the People's Revolutionary Party of Mongolia.
 Wreaths were placed before his black-colour ribboned portrait.    
 Jang Chol, vice-chairman of the SPA, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the c.c., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of foreign affairs, and other officials concerned visited the embassy, paid a silent tribute to L. Enebish and made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Foreign diplomats in DPRK mourn death of L. Enebish
articles.content:
Foreign diplomats in DPRK mourn death of L. Enebish
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys, embassy staff members and representatives of international organizations here visited the Mongolian embassy here today to express condolences over the death of L. Enebish, chairman of the State Great Hural of the Mongolian People's Republic and general secretary of the central committee of the Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party.
 They paid silent tribute to him and made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Message of condolence to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Message of condolence to Mongolian President
    Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message to Mongolian President Natsagiin Bagabandi on Tuesday, expressing profound condolences to the president and the family of the deceased over the death of L. Enebish, chairman of the State Great Hural of Mongolia, from illness.
